conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
Container A is located at the top left, and liquid flows downward from it. There is a horizontal yellow baffle below A.
Liquid from A flows downward, is blocked by the yellow baffle, flows left, is blocked again, and drains into container E.
Container B is located next to A, and liquid flows downward from it. There is no immediate baffle directly below B.
Liquid from B flows downward, mixes with the flow from A, and follows the same path into container E.
Container C is located next to B, and liquid flows downward from it. There is a brown baffle below C.
Liquid from C flows downward, is blocked by the brown baffle, flows to the right, and eventually drains into container F.
Container D is located next to C, and liquid flows downward from it. There are no baffles obstructing the flow below D.
Liquid from D flows downward, unobstructed, and drains directly into container F.
Liquids from A and B flow into container E, while liquids from C and D flow into container F.
Final Answer: Liquids from A and B will flow into container E, while liquids from C and D will flow into container F.
